CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lillie Johnson, church worker, Pittsburgh, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower should invoke the Taft-Hartley Act in steel strike?" answer reads: "I don't think that he would be right. Management and labor should be left alone to work things out themselves.  And both sides should pray."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillie Johnson wearing light colored dress with dark belt and brooch and eyeglasses, posed in front of Beck Shoes, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
